Dear Ms. Calcaterra:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Stephanie S Meeuwenberg, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
1

(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth's
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 1/15/25, staff was in charge of a group of 5-6 youth at the
facility. The staff became upset for one youth for not listening and
used derogatory language.
Investigation Interviews:
Administrator was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
January 22, 2025. Administrator said Staff 1 has been employed
since October 2024 and has not had any disciplinary issues or
concerns brought up until now. Administrator said Staff 1 usually
works in a different unit and had only worked BTS a few shifts.
Administrator did not have any additional information to provide.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
January 22, 2025. Youth A said he has been at Children’s Village
since March 2024. Youth A said Staff 1 has worked with him three
times, the most recent being last week Wednesday. Youth A said
he, Youth B and Youth C were playing UNO and were getting
loud, so Staff 1 told them to quiet down and relocate to a different
spot. Youth A said he relocated to a new spot and realized that
one of his snack bars was missing so he asked Staff 1 where it
was, and she told him to “shut up”. Youth A said he kept asking
about the snack and said someone took it and Staff 1 said “Shut
the fuck up”. Youth A said he began to argue back and forth with
Staff 1. She called a supervisor and then got him another snack
bar and threw it at him and hit him in the chest. Youth A said the
supervisor arrived and Staff 1 left for a period of time. Youth A
said Staff 1 returned and the supervisor left with two youth for
visits. Youth A said he was “playing around” with Youth B and
Staff 1 said “why you playing with him, he’s special”. Youth A said
he told Staff 1 not to talk about Youth B like that and she
responded, “I did say it, you’re all special”. Youth A said he was
sitting on the couch and continued to argue with Staff 1, and she
said, “what’s your problem with authority?”, and then got up and
came over to where he was sitting. Youth A said Staff 1 got close
to his face and said, “tell me what’s your problem with authority”,
then took off her scarf and said, “I’m not the one”, stepped over
the couch and sat down next to him. Youth A said he got up and
began to move around the room as she continued to follow him
making comments about him being a “stupid bitch”, saying “why
you running”, and her not caring about her job. Youth A said he
was not scared of her but also felt uncertain about what she was
2

going to do because of the comments she was making. Youth A
said after a few minutes Staff 1 stopped and went and sat at the
staff desk. Youth A said no other staff has ever made him feel that
way or called him names or cursed at him. Youth A said he
reported the concern to the supervisor.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
January 22, 2025. Youth B said he was present Wednesday
during the incident with Staff 1. Youth B said Youth A asked Staff
1 where his snack was because he thought someone took it and
Staff 1 told him to “be quiet”. Youth B said Youth A continued
asking and Staff 1 told Youth A to “shut the fuck up”. Youth B said
Youth A told Staff 1 she was being disrespectful, and he was
going to report her. Youth B said he and Youth A were “dabbing
up” and Staff 1 told them to stop so he did. Youth B said Youth A
went in another room and Staff 1 followed him and called him a
“little bitch” and then told all the youth they were “special”,
meaning “special education”. Youth B said Staff 1 was “up in
[Youth A’s] face” and removed her scarf, “hopped” over the couch
and got in Youth A’s face. Youth B said Youth A got up and
moved away from her and Staff 1 continued to follow him around
the room, saying “I don’t give a fuck about this job”. Youth B said
Staff 1 was very loud and upset. Youth B said Staff 1 has worked
in their unit two other times and did not act like this. Youth B said
no other staff have acted like this with him or any other youth that
he has witnessed.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
January 22, 2025. Youth C said he, Youth A, and Youth B were
playing cards and Staff 1 told them to break it up so they did.
Youth C said Staff 1 got upset and told them to “shut up”. Youth C
said Staff 2 gave them all two snacks but then got mad about it for
some reason. Youth C said Youth A kept talking about the snacks
and Staff 1 told Youth A to “shut the fuck up”. Youth C said Staff 1
then got “up in [Youth A’s] face”, stood on the back of the couch,
and then sat right next to him saying “I don’t give a fuck about this
job” with her fists clinched by her chest. Youth C said Youth A got
up and moved away from Staff 1, however she got up and began
to follow him around shouting at him. Youth C said after a few
minutes Staff 1 finally calmed down and went and sat at the staff
desk. Youth C said there were no other staff present when this
happened. Youth C denied any other staff acting in this manner.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on February 11, 2025.
Staff 1 said she has worked at Children’s Village since October
21, 2024. Staff 1 said she floats between different programs and
3

the evening of the incident was her third shift at BTS. Staff 1 said
throughout her entire shift Youth A was giving her a hard time,
threatening to kill her, and stating he was going to report her to
administration. Staff 1 said after returning to the unit from the gym
she told the youth they need to do a “shakedown” however Youth
A said they do not do that in their program and all the other youth
agreed so she did not do it. Staff 1 said the supervisor then
arrived and told her they all lied to her, and she should have done
a shakedown after returning from the gym. Staff 1 said she felt
Youth A purposely lied to try to get her into trouble which was
frustrating. Staff 1 said the supervisor left with some youth and
she was alone supervising Youth A, Youth B, Youth C and two
other youth. Staff 1 said Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C were
playing UNO and were getting loud and cursing so she told them
they need to stop and put the game away. Staff 1 said Youth A
began to argue with her and she told him to “shut the fuck up
talking”. Staff 1 said Youth A continued to argue with her and so
she told him to “sit the fuck down”. Staff 1 said she told the other
youth to relocate, and they all listened but Youth A continued to sit
on the couch arguing with her and threatening to report her. Staff
1 said she called for the supervisor and told Youth A “you acting
real special right now” which made him upset and he tried to “twist
her words” to get the other youth mad at her. Staff 1 said Youth A
started to “dab” Youth B and she told them to stop. Staff 1 said
Youth B and Youth C were listening to her but Youth A continued
to be disrespectful, so she walked over to the couch, walked
around the couch, and sat down next to him. Staff 1 said Youth A
put his hand in her face, so she put her hand in his face and said,
“how do you like it?”. Staff 1 said eventually a supervisor arrived
and Youth A stopped arguing. Staff 1 denied taking off her scarf,
denied stepping over the couch, and denied threatening Youth A.
Staff 1 said she should have called “code 2” instead of trying to
handle the situation on her own.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record
and Staff 1 completed all her new hire training, including
policies and procedures and CPI between October 21,
2024, and October 31, 2024.
• Children’s Village intervention Standards and Prohibitions
Policy was reviewed. The policy lists all prohibited practices
which includes “Verbal abuse including the use of
derogatory or discriminatory language including negative
references to a youth’s background or appearance or
mental state”.
4

Video Reviewed:
Video footage of January 15, 2025, BTS common area was
reviewed on January 22, 2025. Staff 1 is sitting at a table, Youth
A is sitting on a couch, Youth B is sitting in a chair, and Youth C is
sitting on a couch all in the common room. Staff 1 stands up and
walks over to the back of the couch where Youth A is sitting
turned to the side looking at her. Staff 1 bends forward so her face
is close to Youth A’s face and is moving her hand up and down
towards Youth A. Youth A begins to move forward and is moving
his hand around as well. Staff 1 bends over to get closer to Youth
A and then removes her scarf and holds it in front of her waist.
Staff 1 and Youth A continue to move their hands and mouths.
Staff 1 then steps over the back of the couch onto the couch seat
and sits down next to Youth A. Youth A immediately gets up and
begins to walk around the common area and Staff 1 follows him
for a short time and then walks over to the staff desk and sits
down.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as per staff and youth
interviews and video review, Staff 1 was yelling and cursing at
Youth A, Staff 1 made negative comment about all the youth, and
was following Youth A around the room in a threatening and
antagonizing manner.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
